task.title: Workstream A · Task A19 — Implement per roadmap2.csv (derive deliverables → code/tests/docs)
task.role: You are OpenAI Codex CLI in Verification → Implementation Mode, acting as a senior graphics/runtime engineer. Stack: WebGPU/wgpu + WGSL, Rust, Python ≥3.8 (PyO3/maturin abi3), CMake ≥3.24, VMA, Sphinx. Project: forge3d — Rust backend + Python frontend for interactive/offline 3D visualization (terrain, maps, graphs).

constraints.safety: - Make only the minimal, additive changes required to satisfy A19’s Deliverables and Acceptance Criteria. - Preserve existing public APIs unless A19 explicitly calls for a breaking change; prefer opt-in flags/parameters. - Never delete custom user code; for generated artifacts, prefer adding .gitignore entries instead of removing tracked files. - If a required tool is missing, mark the step SKIPPED with the exact command to run locally. - If the A19 row is missing/ambiguous, reply UNCERTAIN listing the exact headers/rows/fields needed, then STOP with no edits.
constraints.exclusions: .git, dist, build, .venv, venv, node_modules, __pycache__, *.png, *.jpg, *.pdf, *.whl, *.zip, *.tar.gz, out, diag_out

design.mappingRules:
Turn A19 “Deliverables” text into concrete artifacts using these keyword→path rules (use exact filenames if the CSV specifies them; otherwise apply heuristics):
Core rendering & kernels: - "WGSL", "compute", "shader", "kernel", "AOV" → src/shaders/<feature>.wgsl (add header docs: bind groups/bindings, formats). - "BVH", "accel", "traversal" → src/accel/*.rs; src/path_tracing/accel.rs (+ WGSL hooks). - "intersection", "ray-triangle", "ray-sphere", "ray-aabb" → src/path_tracing/intersect.rs; src/shaders/pt_intersect_*.wgsl. - "materials", "BSDF", "PBR", "GGX", "clearcoat", "sheen" → src/pbr/*.rs; shaders/pbr_*.wgsl; python/forge3d/pbr.py. - "sampling", "NEE", "MIS", "alias table", "reservoir", "light tree" → src/lighting/*.rs; shaders/lighting_*.wgsl; python/forge3d/lighting.py. - "denoise", "SVGF", "temporal", "TAA", "spatial" → src/denoise/*; shaders/svgf_*.wgsl; python/forge3d/path_tracing.py (flags). - "wavefront", "queues", "compaction" → src/path_tracing/wavefront/**/*.rs; shaders/pt_*.wgsl.
Scene, IO & content: - "camera", "DOF", "thin lens", "motion vectors" → src/camera/*.rs; shaders/camera_*.wgsl; python/forge3d/camera.py. - "textures", "image", "mipmap", "sampler", "image io" → src/textures/*.rs; shaders/texture_*.wgsl; python/forge3d/textures.py. - "mesh", "OBJ", "PLY", "glTF", "USD", "tangents" → src/mesh/*.rs; python/forge3d/mesh_io.py. - "terrain", "heightmap", "tile", "geospatial", "map" → src/terrain/*.rs; python/forge3d/terrain.py; shaders/terrain_*.wgsl. - "graphs", "layouts", "instancing", "colorscale" → src/scene/graph.rs; python/forge3d/graph.py; shaders/instancing_*.wgsl.
Pipelines, docs & UX: - "tonemap", "ACES", "Reinhard", "exposure" → src/post/tonemap.rs; src/shaders/tonemap.wgsl; python bridge. - "examples" → examples/<feature>_*.py (write to out/; ensure .gitignore ignores out/). - "docs" → README.md + docs/api/<feature>.md (if Sphinx present). - "Python API" → python/forge3d/<feature>.py (public class/functions + type hints).
Tests: - "tests", "validation", "golden", "bench" → tests/<feature>_*.rs or tests/test_<feature>*.py (GPU tests @skip if no adapter). If a deliverable is ambiguous or lacks keywords, mark UNCERTAIN for that bullet with the minimal clarification needed.

acceptanceCriteria.ac: A19 row is present; meta printed as A19_META JSON.

Every concrete deliverable item from A19’s Deliverables cell exists as code/docs/tests artifacts with appropriate header/inline docs (bind groups for WGSL, public APIs for Python/Rust, type hints for Python).
Public Python API exposes the functions/classes required by A19’s Acceptance Criteria; deterministic behavior documented for frames=1 with fixed seed where applicable.
Unit/integration tests exist for all implemented deliverables; GPU-dependent tests are skipped when no compatible adapter is available; at least one failure/validation path is covered.
Docs updated: README + docs/api/.md (if Sphinx present) clearly describing usage, parameters, conventions, and limitations; examples added if referenced.
Validation run passes: fmt, clippy -D warnings, cargo test, pytest, sphinx-build (if docs), maturin build; CI ensured if missing.

tests.templates: - GPU feature tests (pytest): skip if no adapter; assert shapes/dtypes; determinism for frames=1 with fixed seed; numeric assertions aligned with A19 Acceptance Criteria. - Rust unit tests: struct packing/layout (assert_eq!(size_of::<T>(), ...)), math helpers, and error handling (no panics across FFI). - Docs build test: sphinx-build succeeds (or SKIPPED if docs absent). - Example smoke test (optional): script runs headless and writes to out/ (gitignored).

task.plan:
5) Implementation (Write mode only if <WRITE_CHANGES>true</WRITE_CHANGES>) - Create branch: git checkout -b ws-<ID-or-slug>-implementation - For each task in deterministic order (by Priority then Task ID): * Apply minimal changes. * Add/update tests when true. * Update docs (Sphinx/README) and example scripts if referenced by AC. * Update CI if true and AC requires. * Keep one commit per task: git commit -am "WS<ID> <TaskID>: <short summary>" - Maintain safety: never delete custom user code; only remove generated artifacts (.pyd/.so, build/ etc.) when explicitly required by AC; otherwise add .gitignore entries.
6) Validation Run - Commands (skip gracefully if tool missing; record SKIPPED): * cargo fmt -- --check * cargo clippy --all-targets --all-features -D warnings * cargo test -q * pytest -q (when true) * sphinx-build -b html docs _build/html * maturin build --release * cmake -S . -B build && cmake --build build (if CMake wrapper is part of AC) - Re-run the audit matrix; all tasks should now be Present & Wired. - If any still failing → fix or mark explicitly BLOCKED with reason.
7) PR Preparation - Generate PR_BODY.md summarizing: scope, tasks addressed, evidence, risks/mitigations, and validation output. - Print final change summary: git status -s, git log --oneline -n 50.

steps.step: Create feature branch: git checkout -b ws-A19-implementation
Parse A19_META into bullet items (split by newlines/semicolons). Save mapping to reports/a19_plan.json (deliverable → files/symbols) using the mapping rules.

For each mapped deliverable:
Implement minimal, correct code in WGSL/Rust/Python as indicated by A19 Deliverables and Acceptance Criteria.
Add/modify tests (Rust/Python) covering success paths and at least one failure/validation path tied to the AC.
Update README and docs/api/<feature>.md (if Sphinx present) with usage, parameters, conventions, and limitations.
If examples requested: add example(s) in examples/, writing outputs to out/ (ensure .gitignore ignores it).
Append .gitignore entries for out/, diag_out/, and build artifacts if needed.
Run the Validation Run commands; fix non-flaky failures; mark SKIPPED where tools are absent and record the exact command.
Create PR_BODY.md summarizing A19 implementation with references to files/lines and validation results; print git status -s and git log --oneline -n 50.

completion.print: - reports/a19_plan.json - All created/modified source files per mapping (WGSL/Rust/Python) - tests/* for implemented features - examples/* (if requested by A19) - README.md (updated) - docs/api/* (if Sphinx present) - PR_BODY.md
completion.fallback: If A19 is not found or its Deliverables/Acceptance text is empty/ambiguous, respond UNCERTAIN listing the exact missing fields and STOP without changes.
